file_content.text: You've done me a great favor. You have my gratitude.
It's really done, isn't it? The men who killed my family... you've made them pay?
The names... the names match the dog tags. They're dead--all dead. Go home now, Captain. My wife and daughter are avenged.
I'll have the men prep for departure, sir.
It's... not as satisfying as I expected. Perhaps I should see whether those Republic soldiers had families.
You should make everyone involved pay the price.
Sounds like a plan.
Yes... yes, I think so. I'll start my search at once.
Justice has been served. You won't gain anything by murdering more.
More killing won't help.
You may be right. I'll think on what you've said.
My work here is done.
You've done well for me. Take your reward. Farewell.
I'll be watching through electrobinoculars. Now kill the men who hurt my family.
Master Pontilo? Targets preparing to move out.
But you still refuse to attack.
My men are corporate security, sir. We can't defeat Republic commandos in a fair fight.
Then you're fortunate I see one last option.
Excuse me, my friends. You've arrived at a crucial time. I'd like to put a proposition to you.
Master Sith--Maverse Pontilo, of the Pontilo Foundation. Pardon me for speaking out of turn, but I have a proposition.
Excuse me, officer. Maverse Pontilo, of the Pontilo Foundation. I have a business proposition for you.
You, bounty hunter. Maverse Pontilo, of the Pontilo Foundation. I have a proposition for you.
What sort of proposition?
A proposition?
I don't have much patience.
You're bold to approach me. Bold and foolish.
Arrogant little man.
I've stared down Sith before.
You've got a lot of nerve.
I know the value of time. I won't waste yours.
I am--I was--a businessman. I supported the Empire when this war began, both in and out of the boardroom.
The Republic sent a squad to kill me. They botched the mission--killed my wife and daughter--so my mercenaries tracked the commandos responsible.
We lured them from their base with a distress call, but they came ready for a trap. We can't afford to lose any more men, sir.
I can afford anything! So since my men refuse to strike, I'll pay you to murder every squad member who took part in the attack on my family.
They will learn not to interfere with servants of the Empire.
Time to teach a lesson.
I'll help you and your black little heart. For now.
I do enjoy vengeance.
If there's a commando squad operating on Balmorran soil, it needs to be eliminated.
The Empire's enemies must die.
Doesn't sound like a pretty job. Of course, I can do it.
Might be tricky.
I am pleased we have a deal.
How much?
I've put my fortune into this work. What's left should be enough to satisfy you.
Like it or not, innocents die in war. Murdering these soldiers won't bring your family back.
This is wrong.
No. But it would be only fair.
The commandos are scouting those polluted wastes. I'll need proof of their deaths--blood, dog tags, I don't care--but kill them. Make things right.
I've caused you no trouble. Leave me to my business.
